Text.Value: It's important to remember those who have gone before us. I wish there were more like you.
My dear, precious sister perished recently! Is there nothing that can be done?
There's some strange things happening in this graveyard.
I took care of those grave-robbing kobolds for you.
If you go down all the steps, past the fountain, you'll find the grand mausoleum. There should be one there.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Points the player towards the fancy part of the graveyard, with the overly large gold/grey roofed mausoleum near the extravagent statue and the small pond feature

Text.Value: More killed in bar fights, more killed at home, more attacks on strangers.
Mind you, fear is taking more lives than any one killer. The whole city is on edge, ready to draw steel.
Do you know there are kobolds looting your graves?
Leave.
I'm not joking and I'm done asking. Give me a shovel.
You think you can scare me? You think there is anything I have not seen?

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused that the player thinks they can intimidate you

Text.Value: I need to borrow a shovel, actually.
Leave.
The kobolds made a real mess out there. I'd like to help clean it up.
I hear there's a serial killer out there.
...You're busy. I'll just go.
I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed. Maybe more.
Just want to pay my respects.
I have no time for this - get out before I call the Watch!
Did you know there were kobolds looting your graves?
I hope you have other family to provide you some comfort as you mourn.
I need it to tidy up some of the older graves. I hate to see them neglected.
I don't have a plot left to sell you, yet alone the time to schedule a burial.
Fear is taking more lives than any cult. Everyone is on edge, watching each other, and ready to draw steel.
A shovel? Tell me you're joking.
You steal from those resting in my garden and still expect an audience? Get out.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |Needs a "Did a grave robbing" flag - remove 'IMPOSSIBLE' flag once that's in|

Text.Value: It sounds like you're pretty busy.
This is a house of peace and respect - you are interested in neither. Get out.
I only hope the worst is behind us now that this killer has been dealt with.
Well, there is a serial killer on the loose. Business is booming, unfortunately.
And now I have to look up kobold burial rituals.
I'm grateful that the people in my garden can rest in peace, but I wish there'd been another way. There's been so much death already.

EditorData.NodeContext: Weary on "there's been so much death already"

Text.Value: There - there's one by the grand mausoleum. Down the steps, past the fountain.
What's got you so distracted?
Let them have their baubles if they must. That the bones are left to rest is what matters to me.
Please. Honestly...

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed at the player, responding to them saying "I'll just go"

Text.Value: I saw. I saw their bodies, too. Your doing, I take it.
I'm looking for a grave. Name of M Kurwin?
Pah, there usually isn't much left once I'm done with a body.
That's... very kind, actually. Thank you.
Who's this serial killer targeting?
I might need to tidy up Kurwin's grave. You said it hadn't been cared for.
I deal with the dead, but the Mortarch tends to them, and the living who mourn them.

EditorData.NodeContext: busy, doesn't reall have time for this, trying to be polite

Text.Value: It's good of you to come. He hasn't had any visitors in a long time.
Yes, I just need to borrow a shovel.
Yes, I saw the bodies.
Kurwin? Oh, yes - he's just outside, under the great willow with the drooping branches.
First the kobolds, now you?
Leave me be. You are not welcome in this place.
If you have any concerns about 'strange' goings on, kindly speak to her - she patrols the graveyard. Good day.
Yes and no. The murders were terrible, but all causes of death are on the rise.
Think I'm not used to deviants like you in my graveyard? You aren't special, you know.
I hear there's a serial killer out there. No wonder you're busy.
Can't say. There are a hundred theories, but I see no pattern in who comes through my door.
It is hard to miss, but what can I do? The Watch is too busy to help and I will not fight these thieves.
Don't touch anything.
Great! Now, do you have a shovel I can borrow?
I am sorry for your loss, but - oh, you're back?

EditorData.NodeContext: Repeating her line from earlier ("I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed") when she realises she's met the player before

Text.Value: If you notice any odours before then, treat the body with jasmine, honeysuckle - whatever you can get.
Kelemvor's blessings.

Synopsis:
A weary gravekeeper, absolutely exhausted at having to bury so many bodies in recent days. Would be good to have her have typical gallows humour, but be relatively kindhearted and helpful underneath it (though relatively unimportant) She will exclusively hang around the gravekeeper's house, and likely either be found sat and resting or just idly milling around a small area.

Important topics:
- Where you can find a shovel
- Killings in Baldur's Gate (with a branch for if it's solved)
- (When you've encountered them) Kobold Looters
- Something to chastise the player if they've gone around digging up graves themselves, probably a HasMet alt?
